thread.title: MarketWatch Options Trader: In focus: Resistance is holding

title: MarketWatch Options Trader: In focus: Resistance is holding
text:
Free Preview 
For full access, Log in or Subscribe Now and get 4 weeks free! 
The broad trading range that dominated the Standard & Poorâ€™s 500 Index since January remains intact. 
The S&P 500 index SPX, -0.24% rallied very near the top of the range (2,135) this week and has pulled back since. Thus resistance has held. The lower end of the range is generally at 2,040, but there should be support along the way before a pullback extended that far. The chart of SPX is thus neutral. 
Equity-only put-call ratios are split. The standard ratio continues to rise, and it thus remains on a sell signal. However, the weighted ratio rolled over this week and issued a buy signal. Furthermore, we have been alerting you to the potential of a Total put-call ratio buy signal. That has still not occurred. The 21-day moving average of the Total ratio rose above 0.90, setting up a buy signal when it later crosses below 0.90, but it has remained above there ever since (albeit by a small amount), so the buy signal hasn't been confirmed from the Total ratio yet. To continue reading, please subscribe. Already a Subscriber? Log in
